intro: Cerastium trigynum var. taiwanianum, commonly known as the Taiwan mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, fleshy leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its flowers are primarily pollinated by insects, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds.
